job_title: Technical Support Desk Technician in Rome, GA
pros: The student work program is a really nice way of getting some work experience while you’re in school and earn a little money without having to leave campus. They’re pretty willing to work with you to find placement that you like. Berry is also full of nice people and it has its own culture.
cons: Unless you are a GATE scholar, student jobs do not help cover much of your tuition.

pros: Flexible work schedule, easy job
cons: Manual labor, hot work environment

pros: Berry has a unique environment where students work alongside faculty and staff and are the majority. This provides a unique experience of change and connection every semester. The culture is also to always be involved. Faculty and staff are invited and encouraged to attend everything and be involved everywhere.
cons: The same pros listed above also feel like cons often. The constant revolving door of students and therefore workers can sometimes feel frustrating. Additionally, the culture of Berry to always be involved leads to too many tasks falling on one or every individual often. It is manageable for the most part but can definitely feel overwhelming.

review_title: Helpful if you're under the right person
job_title: Public Relations Director in Mount Berry, GA
pros: the lifeworks program is an amazing way to get a job in a field you think you might be interested in, and typically supervisors are pretty flexible with hours
cons: you might not get placed in a job you're interested in, especially as freshman. Of course you have the opportunity to change where you work, but you may not get placed there right away

pros: Wonderful, caring supervisors, flexible schedule, job support
cons: Limited number of tutors in your area of study can mean difficulty finding coverage on short notice

job_title: Intramural Supervisor in Mount Berry, GA
pros: The boss is very kind and amazing
cons: There are no cons that I can see

pros: Great supervisors who care about you.
cons: They cap the number of hours you can work

pros: Great people very friendly environment
cons: Pay isn't on par with the work..

pros: Great place to work while continuing college degree
cons: None at all...it is awesome!

pros: Primarily tutor lower economics students.
cons: Haven't gained many technical skills.

pros: Works well with students. Supervisors very understanding.

pros: Super easy job, you’re essentially a glorified janitor.
cons: Time consuming, and it is very tedious.

pros: Awesome school with great students!

review_title: Fantastic benefits, will hit a plateau quick.

review_title: A great job for college students

review_title: Laid back environment with absolutely no room for growth

review_title: Generally pretty solid place to work
pros: Pay starts out at $9.00/hr, flexible work schedule, great beginner experience, positive work community
cons: Work is capped to 12 hours / week, and you can't get paid overtime.

pros: Awesome support, great work atmosphere

pros:

pros: If you want a work position one will be given to you

pros: Family oriented and beautiful campus,
cons: None that I can think of!

pros: intimate professor to student ratio

job_title: Physics Tutor in Mount Berry, GA
pros: The hours are very flexible and they allow you to complete homework and other tasks unaffiliated with your tutoring job when there is no one is in for tutoring. The professors are friendly and willing to help you answer questions if they have time.
cons: The pay is rather low for a college level tutor. There are very few resources available to you so you are mostly on your own if a professor is not there to consult. During test weeks it is a bit of a mess with no means of getting more room.

pros: For starters, the pay is decent. The environment is great, and the students and faculty are sweet. You'll get an opportunity to interact with different people who come from all over the world.
cons: What they fail to tell you in the beginning is that there are breaks where the students go home, you can be out of work for up to two months during the summer. They misconstrued the concept and made me believe I would recieve unemployment for those months, which never happened. For Christmas break, you are out of work for two weeks.

job_title: Student Worker in Mount Bethel, GA
pros: Working at Berry was amazing - friendly work culture, supervisors were invested in helping student workers, there was a lot of schedule flexibility, and a wide variety of jobs available to students.
cons: Limitations to the student work program include that hours/wages have strict limits, it may take a while to find a job that's a best fit for a student depending on their career path, and not all departments have the option of a student taking a higher level position as they gain more experience.

review_title: Administration leaves something to be desired.
pros: As an alum, Berry is a place that is very near to me and I loved working at a place that means so much to me. For the most part fellow staff and faculty members are very kind and overall the sense of community is great.
cons: Berry does not put a lot of value on their employees. Employees are significantly underpaid and rarely acknowledged for their accomplishments. There is essentially no room to grow within the organization itself and in many cases you have to fight for professional development.

job_title: Chief Executive Officer of Student Enterprise in Rome, GA
pros: Experience is the primary benefit to working at Berry college as a student. If you are looking for work experience in college and are unsure about applying to a real employer because of credentials, consider going here.
cons: Compensation, work life balance, and job training definitely need some work. Sometimes the impact of your work and efforts are not seen till years down the line. An individual needs a high level of self-motivation, especially in more intensive jobs.

job_title: Student Technician in Mount Berry, GA
pros: Berry College gave me the headstart I needed to pursue careers in related fields. My supervisors in the BITS program were friendly, informed, and understanding of student work/life struggles.
cons: Working at Berry was like a dream come true--for a dream I never knew I had! I cannot even begin to consider what possible downsides there could have been to this incredible experience.

pros:
A lot of opportunities if you're willing to look for them. 
Can work directly with professors in ways you can't at a larger institution
can get even more experience if you're willing to volunteer
Prepares you for parts of professional and academic life that the majors do not
cons:
less funding in the humanities/psychology/etc so study design is limited
Many opportunities  need to be sought it and will not simply come to you

job_title: Student Technician in Mount Berry, GA
pros: Great people, ever changing environment.  Training is provided for free in order to further knowledge.  Lots of available certifications to get.
cons: Lots of work with very little recognition.  If anything with Berry's IT goes wrong, it is YOUR fault, not user error.

job_title: Admissions Video Producer in Rome, GA
pros: The people are awesome, the campus is beautiful, the environment is challenging but relaxed
cons: There are not a lot of open minds because this school is stuck in the idea of having a perfect outside image.

review_title: South Rome Early Learning Center - Student Worker
pros: I absolutely love the full-time staff and the families we work with. It is an extremely rewarding and enjoyable place to be.
cons: Some of the student workers do not work hard enough or engage with the students well and that's very discouraging for those of us who want to see the school succeed.

job_title: Event Programmer in Mount Berry, GA
pros: great work experience, wonderful bosses, great way to earn money while still enrolled as a full time student and meet like minded students
cons: Freshman year finding a job relating to your major can be difficult but as you search for more work opportunities it's easy to find jobs that compliment your course of study.

job_title: Event Programmer in Mount Berry, GA
pros: great work experience, wonderful bosses, great way to earn money while still enrolled as a full time student and meet like minded students
cons: Freshman year finding a job relating to your major can be difficult but as you search for more work opportunities it's easy to find jobs that compliment your course of study.

job_title: Student Worker in Mount Berry, GA
pros: The people are amazing, for jobs on a college campus, any student work position provides a lot of opportunity.
cons: Pay is absolutely abysmal, especially considering the high cost of attendance for the school. Administration changes the student work program and pay whenever they want without input from the students.

review_title: Review of Biology Research Assistant at Berry College
pros: My labmates were wonderful, and the supervisor always worked so hard to teach and to help us develop our skills. I loved learning the many different techniques and reading research literature.
cons: Our work depended heavily on the weather. It was difficult lining up schedules.

pros: Great benefits and substantial time off
cons: They do not promote from within

pros: Work is generally pretty easy because you are a college student. There are multiple opportunities to try different jobs and even get a job in the community working in a field you are pursuing.
cons: Pay is not very good.

review_title: Working for Residence Life makes a small school feel even smaller and more conservative
pros: Getting to be involved, getting to be a mentor to freshman
cons: The Residence Life Employees on campus are too involved with student's personal life, can be invasive and suffocating

job_title: Student Athletic Trainer in Mount Berry, GA
pros: Flexible scheduling, good place to work with people who will always support you. All of my coworkers were friendly and great to work with
cons: Some weeks can have you working quite a few hours and very busy

review_title: Nice place to get a start on your career. Great health benefits.
job_title: Video Production Specialist in Rome, GA
pros: Great community. Supportive supervisors and colleagues. Retirement plan and vacation days allotted are great.
cons: Could pay more and provide more opportunities to grow within company.

review_title: Prepared me for the real world
